meanings.definition: A device or instrument used to hold back organs or tissues during surgery.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon used a retractor to keep the liver out of the way during the operation.
meanings.sent2: The nurse handed the retractor to the doctor before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The retractor decided to take a break and let the organs roam free for a moment.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a retractor, pulling back the emotions she had let out.
meanings.sent5: The retractor was like a superhero cape, keeping the organs safe from harm.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that retracts or withdraws something.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the retractor of secrets, always keeping information to himself.
meanings.sent2: The retractor of the offer left everyone surprised and disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The retractor of the story made everyone curious about what was being hidden.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was a powerful retractor, pulling back any chance of further discussion.
meanings.sent5: The retractor of the curtain revealed a hidden treasure behind it.

meanings.definition: A muscle that draws a part back.
meanings.sent1: The retractor muscle in his arm helped him pull the heavy weight closer to his body.
meanings.sent2: The retractor muscle in her leg contracted, bringing her foot back towards her body.
meanings.sent3: The retractor muscle in his jaw twitched as he clenched his teeth in frustration.
meanings.sent4: Her retractor muscle was like a spring, quickly retracting her hand from the hot surface.
meanings.sent5: The retractor muscle in the cat's paw retracted the sharp claws, avoiding any harm.
